abstract.p: Swissair chief executive Jeffrey Katz is leaving after more than three years of trying unsuccessfully to improve profitability at airline; Katz will become chairman, president and chief executive of Orbitz, consumer travel Web site; Philippe Bruggisser, chief executive of Swissair's parent company, SAirGroup, will take over Katz's post (S)

block.p: Jeffrey Katz, chief executive of Swissair, is leaving after more than three years of trying unsuccessfully to improve profitability at the airline, Europe's fifth largest. Mr. Katz, 45, will become chairman, president and chief executive of Orbitz, a consumer travel Web site. Philippe Bruggisser, chief executive of Swissair's parent company, SAirGroup, will take over Mr. Katz's post. The company gave no explanation for the departure of Mr. Katz, a Californian recruited from American Airlines in 1997.
